intro: Gagea azutavica, commonly known as the Azovian spring beauty, is a small, flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, white or pale pink flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
